remarks: If ` A ` is a line containing two distinct points ` P ` and ` Q ` , then ` A ` is the line through ` P ` and ` Q ` .  Theorem 6.18 of [Schwabhauser] p. 45.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 28-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
statement: linethru $p |- ( ( A e. LinesEE /\ ( P e. A /\ Q e. A ) /\ P =/= Q ) -> A = ( P Line Q ) ) $.
